Package com.apriori.util Description

Miscellaneous utility classes.

These include a Clock and a Stopwatch. The Clock varies considerably from the JRE's Clock. The one here is not meant for general date and time use or inter-op with the java.time package. Instead, it is a light-weight way to abstract System#currentTimeMillis(), System#nanoTime(), and Thread#sleep(long), mainly for testability. (See FakeClock.)

There are also utility classes related to IO, exceptions, cloning, immediate values (which are something between a Future and a Variable), and a handful of other random things.
